actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means

official_title: Approving the extension of nondiscriminatory treatment with respect to the products of Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics, and individual republics which were formerly a part of that nation.

summary.text: Approves the extension of nondiscriminatory treatment (most-favored nation treatment) to the products of the Soviet Union, Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania transmitted to the Congress by the President on August 2, 1991. Approves the extension of most-favored-nation treatment to the products of Russia, Ukraine, Belorussia (a.k.a. Belarus), Moldova, Georgia, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan, Turkmenistan, Tadzhikistan (a.k.a. Tajikistan) and Kirgizia (a.k.a. Kirghizia) upon such republics becoming independent and bilateral trade agreements being reached with them.

titles.title: Approving the extension of nondiscriminatory treatment with respect to the products of Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics, and individual republics which were formerly a part of that nation.
